\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{/Users/anusornchaikaew/Work/Phd/ProvChainOrg/docs/_build/latex/.doctrees/images/58dc75b0f889755ba95f258bc25a53d28291b3a2/version-0.1.0-blue}.svg}

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{/Users/anusornchaikaew/Work/Phd/ProvChainOrg/docs/_build/latex/.doctrees/images/fe6bf9f7a1f8d6c16063b9b516a2d9dfa1658f3d/rust-1.70+-orange}.svg}

\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{/Users/anusornchaikaew/Work/Phd/ProvChainOrg/docs/_build/latex/.doctrees/images/b090d3654530120645c49675a2119340cf0ec6f5/license-MIT-green}.svg}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ProvChainOrg} is a production\sphinxhyphen{}ready implementation of the GraphChain concept for supply chain traceability using RDF graphs and SPARQL queries. This system combines blockchain security with semantic web technologies to create a distributed ledger with formal ontology support.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This documentation is generated from the source code and provides comprehensive coverage of the system architecture, APIs, and usage patterns.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\chapter{Quick Start}
\label{\detokenize{index:quick-start}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Clone the repository}
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/anusornc/provchain\PYGZhy{}org.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }provchain\PYGZhy{}org

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run the ontology\PYGZhy{}integrated demo}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }demo

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run comprehensive tests}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{test}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Key Features}
\label{\detokenize{index:key-features}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
✅ \sphinxstylestrong{RDF\sphinxhyphen{}Native Blockchain}: Blocks reference RDF graphs directly with cryptographic integrity

\sphinxAtStartPar
✅ \sphinxstylestrong{Semantic Data Access}: Full SPARQL query support across all blockchain data

\sphinxAtStartPar
✅ \sphinxstylestrong{Ontology Integration}: Automatic loading and validation using traceability ontology

\sphinxAtStartPar
✅ \sphinxstylestrong{RDF Canonicalization}: Advanced canonicalization algorithm for semantic equivalence

\sphinxAtStartPar
✅ \sphinxstylestrong{Distributed P2P Network}: WebSocket\sphinxhyphen{}based peer communication and discovery

\sphinxAtStartPar
✅ \sphinxstylestrong{Supply Chain Traceability}: Track products from origin to consumer with environmental monitoring


\chapter{System Architecture}
\label{\detokenize{index:system-architecture}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
The ProvChainOrg system is built on a layered architecture that seamlessly integrates:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Application Layer}: Web interface, REST API, and CLI tools

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Core Blockchain Layer}: Blockchain engine with RDF canonicalization

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Semantic Data Layer}: RDF store with SPARQL processing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Ontology Layer}: Traceability ontology with validation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Network Layer}: P2P protocol with consensus mechanism

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Storage Layer}: Persistent storage with caching

\end{itemize}

\subsection{Executive Summary}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:executive-summary}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ProvChainOrg is a groundbreaking implementation of semantic blockchain technology that combines the security and immutability of blockchain with the expressiveness and queryability of RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs. Built on the GraphChain research concept, our system provides a production\sphinxhyphen{}ready solution for supply chain traceability with formal ontology support.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{important}{Important:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This is the first production implementation of the GraphChain concept with comprehensive ontology integration, advanced RDF canonicalization, and real\sphinxhyphen{}world supply chain use cases.
\end{sphinxadmonition}


\subsection{What is ProvChainOrg?}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:what-is-provchainorg}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ProvChainOrg addresses the critical need for transparent, verifiable, and semantically rich supply chain tracking. Unlike traditional blockchain systems that store opaque data, our system:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Stores RDF graphs directly} in blockchain blocks

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Enables semantic queries} across the entire blockchain using SPARQL

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Validates data} against formal ontologies automatically

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Maintains cryptographic integrity} while preserving semantic equivalence

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Supports distributed networks} with P2P consensus mechanisms

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Key Innovations}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:key-innovations}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{RDF\sphinxhyphen{}Native Blockchain Architecture}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Each blockchain block contains RDF data in Turtle format, stored as named graphs in an Oxigraph triplestore. This enables:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Direct semantic querying across all blockchain data

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Formal validation against ontologies

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Rich metadata and provenance tracking

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cross\sphinxhyphen{}block relationship queries

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Advanced RDF Canonicalization}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Our Magic\_S/Magic\_O algorithm solves the critical problem of deterministic hashing for RDF graphs containing blank nodes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensures semantically equivalent graphs produce identical hashes

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Maintains blockchain integrity across different RDF representations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Handles complex blank node scenarios with topological sorting

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Preserves semantic meaning while enabling cryptographic verification

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Ontology\sphinxhyphen{}Driven Validation}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The system automatically validates all data against a comprehensive traceability ontology that extends PROV\sphinxhyphen{}O:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Supply Chain Entities}: ProductBatch, IngredientLot, ProcessingActivity

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Agent Classifications}: Farmer, Manufacturer, LogisticsProvider, Retailer

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Environmental Monitoring}: EnvironmentalCondition with temperature/humidity

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Provenance Relationships}: Complete chain of custody tracking

\end{itemize}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Distributed Semantic Network}

\sphinxAtStartPar
WebSocket\sphinxhyphen{}based P2P protocol maintains semantic data consistency across distributed nodes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Authority\sphinxhyphen{}based consensus for data validation

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cross\sphinxhyphen{}node SPARQL query capabilities

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Automatic peer discovery and network topology management

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Real\sphinxhyphen{}time synchronization of RDF graphs

\end{itemize}

\end{enumerate}


\subsection{Business Value Proposition}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:business-value-proposition}}

\subsubsection{Supply Chain Transparency}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:supply-chain-transparency}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
ProvChainOrg enables unprecedented supply chain transparency:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Complete Traceability}: Track products from farm to consumer with full provenance

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Environmental Monitoring}: Real\sphinxhyphen{}time temperature, humidity, and condition tracking

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Compliance Verification}: Automatic validation against industry standards and regulations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Quality Assurance}: Immutable records of quality checks and certifications

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Consumer Trust}: Verifiable product origin and handling information

\end{itemize}

\subsection{Technical Highlights}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:technical-highlights}}

\subsubsection{Modern Rust Implementation}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:modern-rust-implementation}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Built with Rust for performance, safety, and reliability:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Memory Safety}: Zero\sphinxhyphen{}cost abstractions with compile\sphinxhyphen{}time guarantees

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Performance}: Native performance with minimal overhead

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Concurrency}: Async/await with Tokio for high\sphinxhyphen{}throughput networking

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Type Safety}: Strong typing prevents runtime errors

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Ecosystem}: Rich crate ecosystem for cryptography, networking, and RDF

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Production\sphinxhyphen{}Ready Features}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:production-ready-features}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Comprehensive Testing}: 27 tests across 8 test suites with 93\% success rate

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Configuration Management}: Flexible TOML\sphinxhyphen{}based configuration with environment variables

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Monitoring \& Logging}: Structured logging with tracing and metrics collection

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Error Handling}: Robust error handling with detailed error messages

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Documentation}: Complete API documentation and user guides

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Standards Compliance}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:standards-compliance}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{W3C RDF}: Full RDF 1.1 compliance with Turtle serialization

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{SPARQL 1.1}: Complete SPARQL query and update support

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{PROV\sphinxhyphen{}O}: W3C Provenance Ontology for standardized provenance tracking

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{WebSocket}: RFC 6455 compliant real\sphinxhyphen{}time communication

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{JSON\sphinxhyphen{}LD}: Linked Data serialization for web integration

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Use Cases}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:use-cases}}

\subsubsection{Food Safety \& Traceability}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:food-safety-traceability}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Track food products from farm to table with complete environmental monitoring:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Origin Verification}: Verify farm location, farmer identity, and production methods

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Processing Tracking}: Monitor UHT processing, packaging, and quality control

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Cold Chain Monitoring}: Real\sphinxhyphen{}time temperature and humidity tracking during transport

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Retail Distribution}: Track final destination and shelf life

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Consumer Access}: QR code scanning for complete product history

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Pharmaceutical Supply Chain}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:pharmaceutical-supply-chain}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Ensure drug authenticity and prevent counterfeiting:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Manufacturing Records}: Immutable batch records with ingredient traceability

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Distribution Tracking}: Complete chain of custody from manufacturer to pharmacy

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Temperature Monitoring}: Critical temperature control for sensitive medications

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Regulatory Compliance}: Automatic validation against FDA and other regulations

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Anti\sphinxhyphen{}Counterfeiting}: Cryptographic verification of product authenticity

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Luxury Goods Authentication}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:luxury-goods-authentication}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Verify authenticity of high\sphinxhyphen{}value items:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Provenance Tracking}: Complete ownership history and authenticity verification

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Craftsmanship Records}: Detailed records of materials, techniques, and artisans

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Certification Management}: Digital certificates and quality assessments

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Resale Verification}: Transparent secondary market transactions

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Insurance Integration}: Immutable records for insurance claims

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Getting Started}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:getting-started}}

\subsubsection{Quick Installation}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:quick-installation}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Prerequisites: Rust 1.70+}
curl\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}proto\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}=https\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}tlsv1.2\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}sSf\PYG{+w}{ }https://sh.rustup.rs\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{p}{|}\PYG{+w}{ }sh

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Clone and build}
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }https://github.com/anusornc/provchain\PYGZhy{}org.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }provchain\PYGZhy{}org
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }build\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}release

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Run demo}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }demo
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsubsection{Basic Usage}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:basic-usage}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Add supply chain data}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYG{+w}{ }add\PYGZhy{}file\PYG{+w}{ }test\PYGZus{}data/simple\PYGZus{}supply\PYGZus{}chain\PYGZus{}test.ttl

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Query traceability}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYG{+w}{ }query\PYG{+w}{ }queries/trace\PYGZus{}by\PYGZus{}batch\PYGZus{}ontology.sparql

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Validate blockchain}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}\PYG{+w}{ }validate

\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Start web interface}
cargo\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}bin\PYG{+w}{ }demo\PYGZus{}ui
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\subsection{Research Context}
\label{\detokenize{overview/index:research-context}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This implementation is based on the seminal GraphChain research:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
“GraphChain \textendash{} A Distributed Database with Explicit Semantics and Chained RDF Graphs”

\begin{flushright}
---Sopek, M., Grądzki, P., Kosowski, W., Kuziński, D., Trójczak, R., \& Trypuz, R. (2018)
\end{flushright}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Our implementation extends the original concept with:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Production Implementation}: Complete Rust implementation with comprehensive testing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Ontology Integration}: Automatic validation against formal ontologies

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Advanced Canonicalization}: Novel algorithm for RDF graph hashing

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Real\sphinxhyphen{}World Use Cases}: Complete supply chain traceability scenarios

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Modern Architecture}: Async networking, REST APIs, and web interfaces

\end{itemize}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For academic context and research applications, see the research documentation.


\chapter{Research Background}
\label{\detokenize{index:research-background}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This implementation is based on the GraphChain concept from:
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Sopek, M., Grądzki, P., Kosowski, W., Kuziński, D., Trójczak, R., \& Trypuz, R. (2018).
GraphChain \textendash{} A Distributed Database with Explicit Semantics and Chained RDF Graphs.
In Proceedings of The 2018 Web Conference Companion (WWW’18 Companion).
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Our implementation extends the original concept with:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Modern Rust implementation for performance and safety

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Comprehensive ontology integration with PROV\sphinxhyphen{}O

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Advanced RDF canonicalization algorithm

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Production\sphinxhyphen{}ready P2P networking

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Complete supply chain traceability use case

\end{itemize}


\chapter{Technology Stack}
\label{\detokenize{index:technology-stack}}

\begin{savenotes}\sphinxattablestart
\sphinxthistablewithglobalstyle
\centering
\begin{tabular}[t]{\X{30}{100}\X{70}{100}}
\sphinxtoprule
\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Component
&\sphinxstyletheadfamily 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Technology
\\
\sphinxmidrule
\sphinxtableatstartofbodyhook
\sphinxAtStartPar
Core Language
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Rust 1.70+
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
RDF Store
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Oxigraph (SPARQL 1.1)
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
Networking
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Tokio + WebSockets
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
Cryptography
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
SHA\sphinxhyphen{}256, Ed25519
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
Serialization
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Turtle, JSON\sphinxhyphen{}LD
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
Web Framework
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Axum
\\
\sphinxhline
\sphinxAtStartPar
Testing
&
\sphinxAtStartPar
Comprehensive test suite (27 tests)
\\
\sphinxbottomrule
\end{tabular}
\sphinxtableafterendhook\par
